Also, note the transition from different political systems (from principality to kingdom to people's republic) and the continuity of the finance minister role through these changes.

This document provides a chronological list of Bulgarian finance ministers from 1990 to the present, highlighting political transitions and party affiliations, such as the Union of Democratic Forces, GERB, and independent figures, alongside their respective prime ministers and tenure periods. It also includes historical ministers from earlier eras, spanning the Principality of Bulgaria (1879–1908), the Kingdom of Bulgaria (1908–1946), and the People's Republic of Bulgaria (1946–1990), reflecting the country's evolving governance structures. Key trends include frequent ministerial changes, shifts in political power, and the role of finance ministers in navigating economic challenges during periods of instability. The list underscores Bulgaria's complex political history and the recurring influence of specific parties and individuals in shaping fiscal policy.
